meanings.definition: A person who lends something temporarily.
meanings.sent1: My friend is always happy to be one of the loaners when someone needs to borrow a book.
meanings.sent2: The library has a section for loaners to borrow books for free.
meanings.sent3: The loaners at the party were like book fairies, spreading stories wherever they went.
meanings.sent4: She was a loaner of smiles, always ready to lend one to brighten someone's day.
meanings.sent5: The loaners in the neighborhood formed a lending circle to share tools and resources.

meanings.definition: An item that is borrowed or rented out.
meanings.sent1: The shop had a variety of loaners available for customers to rent for special occasions.
meanings.sent2: The rental company provided loaners for those who needed a temporary replacement vehicle.
meanings.sent3: The loaners on the shelf looked like they were having a party while waiting to be borrowed.
meanings.sent4: The loaners in the store seemed to whisper to each other, sharing stories of their previous borrowers.
meanings.sent5: The loaners in the display window sparkled under the bright lights, enticing passersby to rent them.
